abstract: Negotiators from same 200 countries that signed Paris climate change agreement meet in Vienna to move forward with plan to ban use of hydrofluorocarbons, chemicals used in air cooling and refrigeration systems that trap heat in atmosphere and worsen climate change.
lead_paragraph: Negotiators from around the world are working toward a ban on hydrofluorocarbons, coolants that replaced ozone-depleting chemicals but brought global warming problems of their own.

headline.main: A Sequel to the Paris Climate Accord Takes Shape in Vienna
headline.print_headline: A Sequel to the Paris Climate Accord Is Developing in Vienna

snippet: Negotiators from around the world are working toward a ban on hydrofluorocarbons, coolants that replaced ozone-depleting chemicals but brought global warming problems of their own....
